Post: "I'm such a scatterbrain, I can't even keep track of my belongings. I'm pretty sure I'll never find that book again, it's like it vanished into thin air. Maybe it's a sign that I should just give up on reading altogether, I mean, what's the point if I can't even remember where I put things?"

"Feeling hopeless and lost, I can't help but wonder if it's just my natural disposition to be depressed. Maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole 'life' thing."

Post: "My dog's destructive behavior is a clear reflection of my inability to properly train and care for her. I'm a failure as a pet owner."

"I'm such a failure. I can't even take care of a poor defenseless animal. My dog is better off without me."

Post: "I couldn't unlock my 3G iPhone last week because I'm technologically inept and always have been. Maybe it's a sign of my generation, but I just can't seem to keep up with the times."

Sure, I understand the definition of Internal Attributional Style (IAS) and how it refers to attributing causes to personal characteristics or factors rather than external situational factors. I'm ready to generate a social media post using the IAS format based on the event you provide. Please go ahead and give me the event.
